data.title: Updates consume disk space
data.body:
A large number of updates are stored in ~/Library/Application Support/com.github.atom.ShipIt until you restart Atom.

The autoupdater keeps downloading updates without deleting the older ones, thereby consumin disk space up to 4 GB, as long as the updates keep coming in.  The updates are only deleted until the app is restarted. 

I suggest just keep the latest update. there is not a setting to disable autoupdate

data.title: Crash when opening file belongs to another Atom window
data.body:
I am using xmonad, a tiled window manager in Linux. xmonad provides several workspaces you can switch between. They are like desktops in Mac OS X. Atom crashes every time by the following actions.
1. Open atom, create two Atom windows
2. in Atom window A, open a directory, for example, the Atom repo.
3. Move Atom window B to a different xmonad workspace, so that Atom window A is completely invisible.
4. In Atom window B, open any file in the directory Atom window A opened, for example, `src/text-editor.coffee`.

Expect behavior: the new file is opned in Atom window A.
Actual behavior: Atom crash.

With `atom -l /tmp/atom-log --safe -d`, console reports

```
$ [3286:1004/113333:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(173)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/LinuxSUIDSandboxDevelopment for more information on developing with the sandbox on.
App load time: 245ms
[3286:1004/113334:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(185)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[3286:1004/113334:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(185)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[3286:1004/113334:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(185)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[3286:1004/113334:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(185)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[3317:1004/113334:INFO:renderer_main.cc(200)] Renderer process started
[3286:1004/113334:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(185)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[3286:1004/113334:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(185)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[3286:1004/113334:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(185)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[3286:1004/113334:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(185)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[3321:1004/113334:INFO:renderer_main.cc(200)] Renderer process started
[3286:1004/113337:INFO:CONSOLE(46)] "Window load time: 2408ms", source: file:///usr/local/share/atom/resources/app.asar/static/index.js (46)
[3286:1004/113337:INFO:CONSOLE(46)] "Window load time: 2470ms", source: file:///usr/local/share/atom/resources/app.asar/static/index.js (46)
[3286:1004/113343:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(219)] Gdk: gdk_window_set_user_time called on non-toplevel

[3286:1004/113346:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(219)] Gdk: gdk_window_set_user_time called on non-toplevel

[3286:1004/113346:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(219)] Gdk: gdk_window_set_user_time called on non-toplevel

The program 'atom' received an X Window System error.
This probably reflects a bug in the program.
The error was 'BadMatch (invalid parameter attributes)'.
  (Details: serial 1065 error_code 8 request_code 42 minor_code 0)
  (Note to programmers: normally, X errors are reported asynchronously;
   that is, you will receive the error a while after causing it.
   To debug your program, run it with the --sync command line
   option to change this behavior. You can then get a meaningful
   backtrace from your debugger if you break on the gdk_x_error() function.)
[3321:0100/000000:ERROR:channel.cc(300)] RawChannel read error (connection broken)
```

Atom crashes too early so there is not too many information. If there is any thing could help me to address this issue more deeply, please let me know. I am happy to do further debugging .

data.title: Warning in specs: Error setting item in object: Validation failed at editor.useShadowDOM...
data.body:
Running any package spec produces this warning:

![screen shot 2015-10-02 at 5 12 37 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/69169/10260300/d747734a-6928-11e5-8e95-9fee152d3803.png)

Here's why it's happening:
- `config.set "editor.useShadowDOM", true` is used in the [spec-helper](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/37503b4d03f3f0162738332ff9693641b9ffdd40/spec/spec-helper.coffee#L138)
- true is the default value for this setting, so [`value = undefined if _.isEqual(defaultValue, value)`](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/37503b4d03f3f0162738332ff9693641b9ffdd40/src/config.coffee#L835) in config.coffee:setRawValue() is run
- At this point `atom.config.settings.editor.useShadowDOM` is actually set to undefined.
- When the package is loaded, it resets the config schema, and pushes `atom.config.settings` back through the schema validators. **But** `atom.config.settings.editor.useShadowDOM` is `undefined`, which is not a valid value! So warning

Not sure what to do here. I assume the undefined value is supposed to remove the key from the settings, but I dont know the current state of things. @maxbrunsfeld @nathansobo any insight?

data.title: Change event warning and EBUSY error when saving file

data.title: Add `onDidStopChangingActivePaneItem` for async callbacks
data.body:
`onDidChangeActivePaneItem` is called synchronously when the active pane
item changes, and several non-critical actions preform work on that
event. Critical UI feedback, like changing the active tab, needs to
happen synchronously, but most other functionality should be run
asynchronously.

The code follows the same naming scheme and design pattern as
[`TextBuffer::onDidStopChanging`](https://github.com/atom/text-buffer/blob/v7.1.2/src/text-buffer.coffee#L184), which is exposed as
`TextEditor::onDidStopChanging`.

Fixes #8997.

data.title: [Feature Request] 64bit Windows build
data.body: Would love to get a 64bit version of Atom for Windows, too since Linux and OS X already have it :)

data.title: Multibyte whitespace character causes problems and does not show in Atom
data.body: This is even when white space showing is enabled and working for everything else. Gedit shows the character as a box with (00 \n 99) inside.

data.title: invoke fakeSetInterval callback multiple times if possible
data.body:
This commit is addressing issue #6627. By recording interval
timer's next invoking time, the callback of `fakeSetInterval`
now will be invoked multiple by `advanceClock()`

data.title: Add TextEditor.getUniqueTitle()
data.body:
This PR tries to address issue #7345

This method is intended to replace TextEditor.getLongTitle
and gives a better tab title when there are multiple opened
files have identical file name. It will returns 
<unique-parent-directory>/.../<filename> when opened files
have identical file name. With this PR and updating atom/tabs
multiple files with identical name will look like this.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1419012/10245575/67b28c32-693b-11e5-8a96-5507247dd32f.png)

data.title: Add TextEditor.getUniqueTitle()
data.body:
This PR tries to address [issue 7345](https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/7345)

This method is intended to replace TextEditor.getLongTitle
and gives a better tab title when there are multiple opened
files have identical file name. It will returns 
`<unique-parent-directory>/.../<filename>`  when opened files
have identical file name. With this PR and updating `atom/tabs`
multiple files with identical name will look like this.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1419012/10242420/44e2fe52-6923-11e5-85af-d96e1f5a6e0d.png)

data.title: Fix Windows context menu shortcut
data.body: Fix the bug where Open With Atom on Windows machines will fail for paths containing spaces. Wraps quotes around the path to the Atom executable in the reg key string. This fixes #8658.

data.title: Windows Installer icon broken in Win 7
data.body:
I downloaded and run the latest atom installer (v1.0.19) from official site, and the task bar icon is broken.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3479453/10239517/5fc9aed6-6901-11e5-9fe1-3b6be8d89be2.png)

Let't me know if there's more information I can provide.

data.title: Non-responsive editor due to regex deletes unsaved changes
data.body:
Atom claims to preserve unsaved changes, yet this is repeatedly, frustratingly, proven false.

Steps to reproduce on vanilla Atom:
1. Open an important file, make important changes, do not save them.
2. Open a large text file, ≈ 500000 lines ASCII text, obtained from your client.
3. Open Find/Replace and type a regex that will hang Atom's engine, like `foo_bar_baz|` (notice the port accidentally typed at the end)
4. Atom stops responding.
5. Close window, and reopen.
6. Unsaved changes are lost.

Work should not be performed on the GUI thread, period. This is why.

data.title: Can't catch unhandled promise rejection
data.body:
Since Atom 1.0.18, we can't use

``` js
process.on('unhandledRejection', ...)
```

to catch unhandled rejections.

How to reproduce: in console of latest Atom build, type in 

``` js
setTimeout(function(){Promise.reject(1)}, 100)
```

And verified we get following errors:
![screen shot 2015-10-01 at 1 34 45 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/837180/10233100/61e53f20-6841-11e5-8942-840cb4a3c90a.png)
whereas It is supposed be something like 
`'Unhandled promise rejection %o with error: %o', promise, error)``
according to https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/0a67cb97298eadd16a1d2fae91f9c40566cb879b/static/index.js#L13

data.title: Dialog for read-only files does not go away on Esc
data.body: There seems to be some focus issue -- RET or Esc doesn't act on the dialog.

data.title: Consume two services in single package
Hitting space before a soft-tab doesn't move cursor but moves content
data.body:
I think this is new behavior, so I'm wondering if it's an intentional, but very odd change.

If you have the cursor before a soft-tab and hit space, the cursor won't move but the content following all spaces will.  Until you hit space again then it jumps:

``` js
// Tab-width = 2

|••foo: 42
|•••foo: 42
••|••foo: 42
••|•••foo: 42
••••|••foo: 42
```

Atom 1.0.19


data.title: Syntax highlighting problem in python multiline string containing "CREATE"
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Create a python file, e.g. asdf.py
2. Define a function, with a multinine string containing "CREATE" (within quotes)

``` python
def asdf()
    '''
    "CREATE"
    '''
    print "Hi!"
```

"UPDATE" and "DELETE" give the same result, except those words get highlighted in a different color than the rest of the multiline string.

Expected result:
The code after the multiline string should be syntax highlighted as python code.

Actual result:
Everything after the multiline string is highlighted as if it were a string.

I'm on Atom 1.0.19 and I have disabled my Community Packages.

data.title: Error thrown when trying to move an Editor with gutter between panes
data.body:
Steps to reproduce:
- Install latest linter
- Split the panes
- Move an editor between split panes

Ref: atom-community/linter#913

data.title: As iframe measurements
Atom 1.0.7 wont update after restart and it wont restart
data.body:
I have Mac OSX 10.10 and Atom 1.0.7 and it states there is an update. Ok, so i say download. Mac requests password. Great lets enter that. It downloads then states "restart and install update" Awesome.

Nothing ever happens ..... Waits ..... 15 ..... 30.....45.....50....minutes later. I open Atom, "download update" ... Um ok? "restart and install update" .... um Ok - same loop.

So I cleared out `~/.atom/storage` Same issue.

Help?
